multiple-choice.question: Carleton's Computer Science program has $f$ female students and $m$ male students, where $f \geq 1$ and $f + m \geq 4$. The Carleton Computer Science Society has a Board of Directors consisting of a President and three Vice-Presidents, all of whom are Computer Science students. The President is female and cannot be a Vice-President. In how many ways can a Board of Directors be chosen?
